final_poem:
Echoes in the dark of mind
Flickering lights that dance behind
Images long forgotten fade to grey
Yet linger, whispers of a bygone day

In dreams they resurface like waves on shore
Turbulent and bright, then crashing once more
 Memories lost, yet somehow still retained
A bittersweet nostalgia, not easily tamed

Like autumn leaves, some memories fall slow
Golden hues that glimmer in the cold below
Their fragile beauty, soon to wither fast
Leaving only shadows of a love that will forever last.
